discourse_list.title: Urgent Request of Information regarding Fraudulent/scam case

content.content: Dear MakerDAO Team, We are writing to you as there has been recently a scam and rug pull from a project called compounder. finance. The project has scammed approximately 13m$ and we are investigating further into the team behind it, aiming at bringing more confidence to the DeFi market, and forcing the thief to return the funds to those who suffered from this ‘project’. Here is a post we wrote in public about it https://twitter.com/defiyield_info/status/1333731633393004545 . If you require more information about the scam, please let us know. The stolen funds are currently in the following addresses: https://etherscan.io/address/0x944f214a343025593d8d9fd2b2a6d43886fb2474 https://etherscan.io/address/0x079667f4f7a0b440ad35ebd780efd216751f0758 As you can see, more than half of the stolen funds are in DAI (over 6.8 million DAI), therefore we look forward to your assistance in:  blacklisting the mentioned addresses, monitoring where they are moving their DAI funds and ultimately blocking them.  Needless to say – all those who suffered from the scam are looking out for any help they can get in the DeFi space and beyond. We look forward to hearing from you within shortest possible delays. King regards
content.GPT-summary: The post is a request for assistance from the MakerDAO team regarding a scam and rug pull from a project called Compounder.finance. The author is asking for the team's help in blacklisting the addresses where the stolen funds are located, monitoring where they are moving their DAI funds, and ultimately blocking them. The author also mentions that all those who suffered from the scam are looking for help in the DeFi space and beyond.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: Farming_Lord:   blacklisting the mentioned addresses, monitoring where they are moving their DAI funds and ultimately blocking them.    We are unable to do either of these things. The DAI token does not have a blacklist, nor is it upgradable. Monitoring the funds is relatively straightforward given that they’re on the blockchain, but there’s nothing we can do to prevent them from being transferred. If you want to pursue this yourselves, you can monitor the funds and if they move to a known exchange address you could ask the exchange to seize the tokens.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Actually just came across this write up: https://rekt.ghost.io/deathbed-confessions-c3pr/amp/?__twitter_impression=true
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
